OUTLINE : This pilot study follow randomize study . Patients stratify accord type cancer . - Pilot study : Patients complete qualitative interview explore way anxiety impact patient , identify component cognitive-behavioral therapy intervention useful , determine optimal method delivery intervention ( e.g. , number timing intervention , administration chemotherapy infusion feasible ) . Based upon result full treatment manual write use randomize study . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I ( cognitive-behavioral therapy ) : Patients undergo six-seven 90-minute treatment session ( 2 month ) base result pilot study . Modules include psychoeducation goal setting ; relaxation training ; cognitive restructuring ; cop cancer fear ; activity planning pacing ; review , termination , plan continue use skill . - Arm II ( routine care ) : Patients receive routine medical care . At completion treatment , participant meet blinded independent assessor ass outcome . Patients undergo psychiatric evaluation , include Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale ( HAM-A ) , Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale ( MADRS ) , Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview ( MINI ) , psychosocial self-reported battery baseline 2-3 month .
